_header: Displeasure thought wrath woe ne heaviness
_description:
The hopes of the lover, translated from the French of Charles d’Orléans (Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 67) — three 8-line stanzas and 4-line envoy

BLHar682.First Lines: DIsplesere thought wrath woo ne hevynesNor turment noon that kan to me abounde…
BLHar682.Last Lines: …That in short tyme this shall be me gardownnidThe grettist good that may to me ben falle
